title: Google Analytics 4 & Performance Optimization
description:
Implement Comprehensive Website Performance and Analytics Optimization

Integrate Google Analytics 4 with privacy-compliant configuration and implement full-stack performance optimizations to achieve Lighthouse scores of 95+ across all core metrics.

Requirements:

Google Analytics 4 Integration:
- Install and configure GA4 with privacy-focused settings (IP anonymization, consent mode, data retention policies)
- Implement cookie consent banner with granular user controls
- Load GA4 script asynchronously to minimize performance impact
- Configure essential event tracking (page views, user interactions, conversions)
- Ensure GDPR/CCPA compliance with opt-out mechanisms
- Test tracking functionality across different consent scenarios

Image Optimization:
- Convert all images to WebP format with fallback support for older browsers
- Implement lazy loading for all below-the-fold images using native loading="lazy" or intersection observer
- Generate and implement responsive image sets using srcset and sizes attributes for multiple viewport sizes
- Add proper width and height attributes to prevent layout shift (CLS)
- Compress images without visible quality loss
- Consider critical images for preloading in <head>

CSS/JS Minification and Optimization:
- Minify all CSS and JavaScript files for production
- Remove unused CSS (PurgeCSS or similar)
- Implement critical CSS inlining for above-the-fold content
- Bundle and tree-shake JavaScript to eliminate dead code
- Enable gzip/brotli compression on server
- Use async/defer attributes appropriately for script loading

Lighthouse Performance Targets (95+ scores):
- Performance: LCP < 2.5s, FID < 100ms, CLS < 0.1, FCP < 1.8s, TTI < 3.8s
- SEO: Valid meta tags, semantic HTML, mobile-friendly viewport, proper heading hierarchy, descriptive alt text
- Accessibility: ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, sufficient color contrast (4.5:1 minimum), focus indicators, screen reader compatibility
- Best Practices: HTTPS, no console errors, modern image formats, proper cache headers

Testing and Validation:
- Run Lighthouse audits on multiple pages and device profiles
- Verify analytics tracking in GA4 real-time reports
- Test image loading across various network conditions (3G, 4G, fiber)
- Validate privacy settings with browser dev tools and consent testing
- Document baseline vs. optimized metrics
